meanings.definition: Use superior strength or influence to intimidate (someone), typically to force them to do something.
meanings.sent1: The big kid was bullying the smaller children on the playground.
meanings.sent2: Stop bullying your classmates into giving you their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The playground bully was caught bullying again, but this time he got detention.
meanings.sent4: The aggressive salesperson was bullying customers into buying products they didn't need.
meanings.sent5: The dictator was known for bullying his citizens into submission with fear and threats.

meanings.definition: Seek to harm, intimidate, or coerce (someone perceived as vulnerable).
meanings.sent1: She felt scared when the group of kids started bullying her after school.
meanings.sent2: The online troll was bullying others with hurtful comments on social media.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bullying the dog by stealing its favorite toy and running away.
meanings.sent4: The aggressive competitor was bullying smaller businesses out of the market.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive driver was bullying other cars on the road by tailgating and honking incessantly.
